channel.title: Error connecting to Server
channel.description:
I am using a Client/Source named Rune-Vision, I portforwarded, replaced all "Rune-Vision.no-ip.info" searched every "0.0.0.0"/"127.0.0.1"/"Server =" in every .java, but when I use Teamviewer to control a friends computer, and use Moparscape or RV Client, I get "Error connecting to Server."
Edit: I have checked CanYouSeeMe.org. I got "Success: I can see your service on 99.173.55.*** on port (43594)" Your ISP is not blocking port 43594
Help? :)

item.title: Error connecting to Server
item.dc:creator: @Extrania Extrania
item.description:
@Extrania wrote:

Replace the IP in the CLIENT with the 99.xxx.xxx.xxx IP
Compile and send it to your friend, that should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to Server
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

The only thing I’m thinking is that your firewalls not letting the connections through. :S

Read full topic

Uhh. Ok. Did you compile? Ik that’s a xommon mistake I make a lot lol

Compiled the Client? Affirmative.
[/quote]haha uhh running the server? (Ik I probably sound like an idiot but if hat thng says it’s making a connection you should be good.)[/quote]

Im playing right now, buying Torva. ;D

Hmm, There isn’t some hidden IP in Source maybe…?

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to Server
item.dc:creator: @Evaur Evaur
item.description:
@Evaur wrote:

runewings317:

Port forward… People won’t be able to connect to your server (hosted on your PC) from the IP 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 cause their local host, so it will only work for you.

I have Portforwarded Both TCP and UDP.

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to Server
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

Port forward… People won’t be able to connect to your server (hosted on your PC) from the IP 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 cause their local host, so it will only work for you.

Read full topic
